title: Gettext JSON Schema
description: The Gettext JSON Schema is used to validate the structure of a Gettext translation file. The primary required key is translations, which contains the translations object.

flags.description: The flags used to mark the translation file.

oneOf.description: The flag is used to mark the translation file. The flag is case-insensitive.
The flags array contains flags that are used to mark the translation file.

items.description: The flags are used to mark the translation file. The flags are case-insensitive.

references.description: The references used to identify the original source of the translations.

oneOf.description: The reference is used to identify the original source of the translations.
The references array contains references to the original source of the translations.

items.description: The references are used to identify the original source of the translations.

comments.description: The comments used to provide additional information about the translation file.

oneOf.description: The comment is used to provide additional information about the translation file.
The comments array contains comments about the translation file.

items.description: The comments are used to provide additional information about the translation file.

translation.description: The translation object contains the translation of a single message.

enable.description: The enabled key is used to enable or disable the translation. If the key is not present, the translation is enabled by default.

msgid.description: The msgid key is the original message that needs to be translated.

msgid_plural.description: The msgid_plural key is the plural form of the original message that needs to be translated.

msgstr.description: The msgstr used to store the translated message.

oneOf.description: The msgstr field contains the translated message.
The msgstr array contains the translated messages.

revision.description: The revision number of the translation file.

headers.description: The headers object contains metadata about the translation file. The required language key is used to identify the language of the translation.

project-id-version.description: The project-id-version key is the name and version of the project.

creation-date.description: The pot-creation-date key is the date and time when the POT file was created.

revision-date.description: The po-revision-date key is the date and time when the PO file was last revised.

last-translator.description: The last-translator key is the name and email address of the last translator.

language-team.description: The language-team key is the language and email address of the translation team.

language.description: The language key is the language code of the translation.

mime-version.description: The mime-version key is the MIME version of the translation file.

content-type.description: The content-type key is the content type of the translation file.

content-transfer-encoding.description: The content-transfer-encoding key is the content transfer encoding of the translation file.

plural-forms.description: The plural-forms key is the plural forms of the translation file.

.*.description: This is a translation object. The key is context, and the value is the translation object.

^$.description: This is a translation object. The key is context, and the value is the translation object.
